map.param: Always overwrite any existing output files
keep unused logic
Print a more verbose map report.
Effort level
Perform post-placement physical synthesis combinatorial logic optimizations during timing driven packing (default is off).
Pack internal flops/latches into input IOBs (i), output IOBs (o), both types of IOBs (b), or internal fabric such as slices, BRAMs, or DSP blocks (off). (default is off).
Multi-threading. Default is "off". When "on", software will decide how many processors it should use (depending on what's available).
Power optimizations.
Enable Performance Evaluation Mode. In this mode, the tools will ignore any timing constraints specified in a constraints file and auto-generate timing constraints to drive tool performance.
Use specified part type to implement the design

par.param: Always overwrite any existing output files
Overall effort level. high is maximum effort. Default: std (standard) for older architectures high for Virtex5, Virtex6 and Spartan6

Ignore user timing constraints in physical constraints file and generate timing constraints automatically for all internal clocks to increase performance. Note: the level of performance achieved will be dictated by the effort level (-ol std|high) chosen.
Power Aware Par. Optimizes the capacitance of non-timing-driven design signals.
Turns off generation of the pad report.
Multi-threading enabled. 4 is the maximum number of threads.Default: off. Supported only for virtex5, virtex6, spartan6 and higher architectures.

ngdbuild.param: Regenerate NGO only when source netlist is newer than existing NGO file (default)
Use specified part type to implement the design

map.param: Always overwrite any existing output files
keep unused logic
Print a more verbose map report.
Perform post-placement physical synthesis combinatorial logic optimizations during timing driven packing (default is off).
Effort level
Perform global optimization before mapping (default is off)
Multi-threading. Default is "off". When "on", software will decide how many processors it should use (depending on what's available).
Do not use RLOC constraints to generate RPMs. Default is "off". Use RLOCs to group logic together within a Slice, but not to control the relative placement of Slices with respect to each other.
Pack internal flops/latches into input IOBs (i), output IOBs (o), both types of IOBs (b), or internal fabric such as slices, BRAMs, or DSP blocks (off). (default is off).
LUT Combining. Merges pairs of Look Up Tables (LUTs) with common inputs into single dual output LUT6s in order to improve area.
Power optimizations.
Enable Performance Evaluation Mode. In this mode, the tools will ignore any timing constraints specified in a constraints file and auto-generate timing constraints to drive tool performance.
Use specified part type to implement the design

par.param: Always overwrite any existing output files
Overall effort level. high is maximum effort. Default: std (standard) for older architectures high for Virtex5, Virtex6 and Spartan6

Ignore user timing constraints in physical constraints file and generate timing constraints automatically for all internal clocks to increase performance. Note: the level of performance achieved will be dictated by the effort level (-ol std|high) chosen.
Power Aware Par. Optimizes the capacitance of non-timing-driven design signals.
Turns off generation of the pad report.
Multi-threading enabled. 4 is the maximum number of threads.Default: off. Supported only for virtex5, virtex6, spartan6 and higher architectures.
